entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 13 at 5:26AM AKST until February 14 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 70 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. expected. * WHERE...Central Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Now to 6 PM Monday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 3:19AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Brief Return to Winter Monday Night into Tuesday Morning... After another dry and warm day today, a fast moving slider-type low pressure system and cold front will move quickly across eastern California and the Great Basin late Monday into Tuesday. This will bring an increase in winds Monday afternoon, and colder conditions with a short period of rain and snow Monday evening
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 3:19AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Brief Return to Winter Monday Night into Tuesday Morning... After another dry and warm day today, a fast moving slider-type low pressure system and cold front will move quickly across eastern California and the Great Basin late Monday into Tuesday. This will bring an increase in winds Monday afternoon, and colder conditions with a short period of rain and snow Monday evening
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Northern Washoe County; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake
